intro: Erysimum grubovii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill wallflower, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as hillsides and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Erysimum grubovii is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
